bibl.title: Bilingualism and the Latin Language.
bibl.note: Voir en part. chap. 5: Latin in Egypt (I. Introduction; - II. The evidence from Egypt; - III. Language choice as an expression of power or act of accommodation; - IV. Latin as a language of power; - V. Accommodation: introduction; - VI. Further aspects of diglossia in Egypt; - VII. Language use in the army in Egypt; - VIII. The learning of Latin in Egypt; - IX. Conclusion; - Appendix: the trilingual inscription of Gallus [I. Philae II, 128]); - chap. 8: The Latin of a Learner (P. Amh. II, 26 [= Pack2 172]): A Case Study.
